Chairs announcementsThe Chair made the following announcements:                                 Workshop: The Chair announced that a workshop on Robots In Healthcare:A Solution Or A Problem? organised by the Health Working Group and cochairedby Soledad Cabezon Ruiz and Alojz Peterle would take place onTuesday, 19 February, from 15:00 to 17:00. highlights.text: oceanographer    Dr Earle, a charismatic oceanographer who has lived underwater ten times, shared herexperience and views on the nature of life in the oceans and the progress made on SDG 14. Sheexplained how the development of scuba technology and robots had led to greater knowledgeabout marine life, and made us aware the about dangers of pollution, climate change,biodiversity loss and international trade in marine wildlife. Dr Earle highlighted the importanceof using nature-based solutions, scaling-up

title: AMENDMENTS 663 - 998 - Draft report proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on the sustainable use of plant protection products and amending Regulation (EU) 2021/2115

highlights.text: Copernicus LandMonitoring Service.    EN    PE745.543v01-00 62/176 AM1275926EN.docx    Or. en    Justification    Several European railway companies have already use alternatives to pesticides such as hotwater or robots to regulate vegetation along the tracks. The railways should therefore not beexcluded from the definition of sensitive areas due to the potential threat to the quality ofgroundwater and surface waters, but also impact on the people living in the vicinity
